intro: Osbeckia rubropilosa, commonly known as the red-hairy willow, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. Osbeckia rubropilosa is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks.
